Hierarchical graphics library

Detailed Description

Hierarchical graphics library provides support for hierarchical transformations, key-framed animations and scene file input/output.

Scene files can be loaded by creating Scene class instance with scene file name as parameter (and additional paths for textures and shaders if needed).

Key-framed animation playback is handled by TransformAnimation and TransformAnimationSet classes. For simple usage example see samples/hgr_file_test. Scene class also provides shortcut for scene-wide animation playback, applyAnimations(time).

Different rendering pipes (see Pipe and derived class GlowPipe and DefaultPipe) provide more abstract usage level for different rendering techniques. For example application can render normal scene and then glow on top of that with one line call. Even tho convenient and time saving, rendering pipes have still been kept as very simple so that user can easily define own pipes if needed, or even go to more low level rendering support and skipping pipes altogether. Only sample application to use rendering pipes is currently samples/render_to_texture_test -- all others use Camera and Context classes directly. See DefaultPipe for most simple rendering pipe implementation.

Function Documentation

BEGIN_NAMESPACE ( hgr   ) 

Keyframe sequence of flexible format keyframe data.

Note that the light properties are only 'hints' to the shader which is used to render the geometry. Actual shader might or might not use some specific property and the usage of light properties is shader dependent.

Type of light.

Unknown light type.

Distant light source (like sun).

Omnidirectional point light source (like a candle). Default.

Spot light source (like a lamp).

Number of different types.

Maximum light range.

Maximum (spotlight) cone angle.

Creates default white light.

Create a value copy of this light.

Returns clone of this node. Clones child nodes as well.

Sets type of the light.

Sets color of the light.

Sets angle, in radians, of a fully illuminated spotlight cone.

See also:
setOuterCone
Sets angle, in radians, defining the outer edge of the spotlight's outer cone. Points outside this cone are not lit by the spotlight.
See also:
setInnerCone
Sets distance in world space when light starts to fade away. Maximum allowable value is maxRange().
Parameters:
farstart Distance when light starts to fade away.
Sets distance in world space beyond which the light has no effect. Maximum allowable value is maxRange(). Updates node bounding volume.
Parameters:
farend Distance when light has faded away.
Illuminates a point on surface by this light.

Returns light distance attenuation [0,1] by distance.

Parameters:
dist Distance from point to light.
Returns light shape attenuation [0,1] by distance.
Parameters:
cosa Cosine of angle between light direction and vector from light to point.
Returns type of the light.

Returns angle, in radians, of a fully illuminated spotlight cone.

See also:
setOuterCone
Returns angle, in radians, defining the outer edge of the spotlight's outer cone. Points outside this cone are not lit by the spotlight.
See also:
innerCone
Returns distance in world space when light starts to fade away. Maximum allowable value is maxRange().
Parameters:
farstart Distance when light starts to fade away.
Returns distance in world space beyond which the light has no effect. Maximum allowable value is maxRange(). Updates node bounding volume.
Parameters:
farend Distance when light has faded away.
Returns color of the light.

END_NAMESPACE (  ) 

Unicode (UTF-8) text rendering console.

Speculative interface which allows 'try to read option' style usage so you can try to get some command line option and if the query fails you can ask it with prompt.

Creates simulation world, collision space and contact group, using default settings (gravity 9.8 m/s2, etc.)

Parameters:
groundlevel Absolute minimum Y-coordinate which limits free falls.
Sets gravity in simulation world. Default is -9.8 along Y-axis.

Simulates time step. Calls user specified collision checker to find out contacts between two objects.

Parameters:
dt Time step to simulate.
checker Collision checker to be used to find contacts. Pass 0 to use default.
Returns simulation world.

Returns collision space.

Returns contact group using in collision detection.

Returns number of enabled bodies in the simulation. Good for performance tuning, as number of simultaneous enabled bodies should be low for best performance.
